title.narrative: AIR POLLUTION

description.narrative: national and sub-national health and environment authorities in target areas have improved capacity to legislate, budget, deliver and coordinate interventions to mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children in Mongolia benefit from increased access to and utilization of services that promote health and nutrition, including Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and interventions that mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: national and sub-national health and environment authorities in target areas have improved capacity to legislate, budget,deliver and coordinate interventions to mitigate the impact of air pollution on child survival

description.narrative: Realising the environmental rights of children and reduce exposure to air pollution has been a priority in 2021. The Teen parliament project was implemented together with the Parliament of Mongolia to enhance children’s knowledge, implement child-led climate actions in communities and bring children’s voices to the highest policy making body in Mongolia. 541;additional households, kindergartens and schools installed;Cooking, heating and insulation package (CHIP) and Clean air action plan was approved by 02 provinces. Interventions by UNICEF have been integrated into the Action plans for implementation of National environmental health programme 2021-2025 and NDC Mongolia 2025 to Paris Agreement. ;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2021
